title: Would you like a sort of Servant? - m4w
text:
Hello... how are you? Thank you for reading.

I wanted to post this ad and try to explain this concept in a little bit of detail. For starters, let me say that I am a submissive... shocker I know. I have called myself one for most of my adult life, although I shake my head at some of the things I used to do when I was younger. But that's not really the point. The point is, I've been around as a submissive for a long time and I like to think I know what I'm doing.

I would like to be a servant to someone. Beyond that, what I genuinely want to do is to "give the gift of anything". To be more specific. I would like to meet someone for somewhere in the ballpark of 2-3 hours at a time. During that time I would like for her to consider me a tool, an object to use for her benefit, period. I have some limits, which we can discuss ahead of time, but not all that many. We would have a safe-word in case things went off the rails. But beyond that, I will do as I am told, period. This can apply to a great many things, but as just a few suggestions. I can cook, clean, do housework, yard work, other manual labor. I can give massages, foot rubs, and other personal services. I can be a dummy to hang clothes on if you so desire. I can be a footrest or bench, or you can have me dance around like an idiot for your amusement. Be clever, be creative, and don't be hesitant.

You may wish to know what I am looking for in return... and that is just it. What I want, genuinely, is to be an object for just that period of time. I want you to not be hesitant to very simply use me. I want you to tell me what to do with no thought towards what I do OR do not want. At no time should my pleasure factor into your thoughts... but for that matter neither should my discomfort. If it so happens I enjoy something you want done, then so be it. If it so happens I don't particularly like something, then so be it as well. I will do my best not to show my preferences in the same way that a toaster doesn't have an opinion about the sort of bread you put inside it. 

My enjoyment in this is, very simply, giving you the gift of whatever you want. I want to say the word "anything", and for the most part, mean it. Being allowed to give that gift is what I am seeking.

So I am not sure if this ad will garner much response, but I am more than happy to talk it out with anyone who might even be a bit curious.

title: A fantasy relived
text:
I've only done this once about two years ago, and for some reason lately I can't stop thinking about it. At the time I was living in MA, he was living in CO. He was on the east coast on a business trip and contacted me on an online dating app. We didn't end up meeting while he was in town, but kept in touch. Chatted online, phone, skype for about a couple months until I had occasion to go on a business trip in his neck of the woods. 
I was 38, very long black hair, big brown eyes, curvy build, pouty lips, manicured fingers and toes, cute smile, affectionate touch. He was 28, but looked even younger. Smooth, athletic body. Smooth face. About 5'10, perfect height difference for spooning. Stamina expected of a guy in his 20's. 
When we finally met in person we had built up quite the sexual tension. And so we decided to meet at my hotel rather than waste time in awkward small talk. After all, we'd been talking for two months already. Long conversations about life, family, dreams and hopes for the future. Turns out we went to the same college. In order to cut down on my nervousness, I asked that we black out the room. And so when he came in, it was pitch black, except for the little bit of light coming from my ipod.
He touched my face as his eyes adjusted to the darkness. Kissed me before we even left the hallway. He put his arms around me and nuzzled my neck as he walked me backwards toward the bed. We made love for hours and I lost count of how many orgasms I had before we finally decided to light some candles. From there it was massage and light touching for the rest of the night. 
We kept in touch for a few more months. Saw each other another couple times while traveling until we started dating other people in our own states.

title: Looking for nice......
text:
Hello,

Thought I would try a CL post after dating sites seem to be about endless emailing. Since I have been told that men appreciate direct, to the point communication.....here goes.....

I am in my 40's, no children, home owner, and a successful career. I am smart, independent and overall very happy with my life. I don't need a man ....but want one now after a long break from dating but am having a hard time finding a nice one! I am independent and capable but actually have very old fashioned values - which seems like a contradiction but it is not. I prefer to live in a rural area...my house is surrounded by trees and try to be outside as much as I can after all week in the office working. 

What do I like? Strong, capable men, typically blue collar guys that can fix stuff.....I respect guys that have a skill/trade. I work with men in "suits" all day...so boring. I love men that are thoughtful and considerate.... If you can fix a sink and love my dogs, I might fall in love with you. Seriously.

I don't need you to have a lot of money, I can take care of myself financially. I have been renovating my house for the last 4 years and am almost done - not looking to use anyone for theirs skills :). I do like to travel, read, visits new places, and am pretty liberal/open minded. I love to cook, and would like to have someone to cook for...but admit I hate doing the dishes. 

I am an affectionate person, miss having a sexual connection with someone and have a healthy sex drive. Hope you do too. As interested as I am in passion - this only comes after we get to know each other. I am completely healthy and have not been with many partners---- I tend to have long relationships. 

If you are between 40-55, SINGLE, tobacco free, healthy, love animals.....and live within 45 minutes of the Hebron/Colchester area. 

If you have kids hoping they are older (college age or older) - my heart has been broke with knowing younger children only to say goodbye. 

I don't have a type, but a photo does help initially. Please be fully dressed in the photo - including shirt and pants (no naked, shirtless, or just underwear photos). I am not interested in your body - I don't care. Just want you to be healthy. I will share a photo too. 

I will answer thoughtful emails, I won't answer emails that contain just a word or two, ask or demand my phone number or demand a photo. Gee whiz....I am looking for a nice guy not a rude one.

Abby abruptly withdrew her sticky hand, grabbed a McDonald's napkin, and picked up her iPhone. "Yes, hello?" Abby asked, a little breathlessly.

"Abigail? Are you OK, dear?" asked a cheery voice. "Suzanne Moffatt here. Just wanted to make sure you'll be here on time to pick up Emma's cookies."

"Sure, I'll be on time, ma'am," said Abby. "I'm almost there."

After hanging up, the young mom shivered thinking of Mrs. Moffatt, her daughter's perfectly proper troop leader. The ever-smiling Suzanne Moffatt looked like something out of a Betty Crocker commercial, with a beauty-parlor hairdo, starched blouses and sensible shoes. Mrs. Moffatt and the other moms from the troop were overly polite to her, but Abby always felt like these power moms disapproved of her.

"I'm too young. I'm too blond. I'm divorced. And my tits are too big," Abby thought to herself, hiding a smile. "At least I can still fit in my Girl Scout uniform." As she drove to Mrs. Moffatt's, the blonde smoothed the badge-covered sash over her large breasts.

"Jesus! My nipples! They are OUT!" As she parked her minivan in the driveway, Abby looked down at her chest in a panic. Her nipples were now erect, and much more obvious than before her little mental trip down memory lane. She sighed, shook her head, then giggled.

Walking up the sidewalk, Abby tried hunching her shoulders to minimize her jiggling breasts, but they refused to be shy, sticking out high and proud. "Oh well. At least I'm here when I promised," thought Abby, standing up straight as she knocked on the door.

"Why Abigail, how nice to see you!" Suzanne Moffatt, said brightly, showing all her capped teeth in a wide smile. "Do come in!" Mrs. Moffatt's eyes carefully avoided Abby's big tits under the diagonal sash. "How cute, wearing your old uniform! I'm sure you know only girls SELLING cookies can wear their uniforms during Girl Scout cookie time!"

The young blonde walked into the living room, which was piled high with stacks of Girl Scout cookie boxes. The spotlessly clean room looked like Martha Stewart had just finished decorating it.

Abby adjusted her green beret over her disheveled hair. Her nipples pointed straight at Mrs. Moffatt. "Sorry; I just ran out of the house."

The older mom flashed another toothy smile. "Why dear, I understand! I'm a mess myself!" Mrs. Moffatt touched her flawless brown flip. "And look at me! I might as well be in DUNGAREES!" Mrs. Moffatt wore a navy blue blazer with matching navy blue slacks. Her tasteful silk blouse was topped with an understated strand of pearls.

"Do you have Emma's cookies ready for me to pick up?" asked Abby.

title: "Why is it so Complicated?" Someone local.
text: Hello, I am looking for ""Long term"" not dating outside of the relationship, because I believe if you date more then one you can't focus your heart with someone truly and honestly. I'm new at this, never filled out one of these before but I'm tired of the game, I just want to meet somebody cool smart and fun !!! whom we can make the World our playground. I am an honest, trustworthy man with high morals and family values. I like to laugh,and socialize and know how to treat a woman to feel loved and secure. I like to cuddle while watching movies, especially on rainy days, feeling cozy. I love to give unexpected gifts and treasure a commitment. I'm a homeowner and financially stable. I'm not sure what I'm looking for in a woman anymore. It keeps changing with each relationship that I've been in. I guess I'm looking for someone who I can talk to like my best friend, who is honest, and who is willing to go that extra mile for me like I would for her. Chemistry and attraction are important to me, too, but one doesn't outweigh the other. I think for me there has to be at least a little of each for it to work. I have learned a lot from my past relationships; about what I do and don't want in one. I don't play games because I have no need to. I am comfortable and confident with who I am. I can take care of myself but I would prefer to meet a great women and we can take care of each other. I appreciate the little things in a relationship that help to make and keep it special. Chemistry is key. When you find that certain something in another person and you can't get enough of them.... that's what I'm looking for. Do what makes you happy, be with who makes you smile, laugh as much as you breathe and love as long as you live. Just a normal guy trying to find the right woman for me. I consider myself honest and polite, but I'm a total goof at times, too. I have a good sense of humor and I don't take life too seriously. I'm financially and mentally stable - lol. I've got a lot of good friends and I'm close to my family as well. I like animals a lot. I like the outdoors, the beach, movies, music/shows, going out to dinner, shooting pool, playing cards, home improvement projects, computers/gaming, sports, and a bunch of other things. title: Boycott Ocean State Job Lot, UPS, Cumberland Farms
text:
North Kingstown -- NBC 10's Gene Valicenti reports that Rhode Island based Ocean State Job Lot is suspending plans for a half-million square-foot, 50-million-dollar warehouse addition to its North Kingstown headquarters. Ocean State Job Lot announced Saturday that it has put its plans on hold in the wake of Rhode Island Governor Gina Raimondo's insistence on truck tolls aroubd the state.
Ocean State Job Lot co-owner Marc Perlman says Raimondo's plan is bad for business and singles out certain industries like his. The suspension of building the warehouse negatively impacts bringing 100 plus jobs to Rhode Island. UPS has also threatened to cut jobs in Rhode Island over new tolls and Cumberland Farms has also called the tolls bad for business.

PROVIDENCE, R.I. -- Several Providence College Students stood outside the college's gates Wednesday to support five women who said they were denied access to an off-campus party over the weekend because they are black. "The guy holds the door and says, 'Do you people really think you're going to get into our party?" said Adrianna Ateh, a sophomore. A ten and the other women reported being cursed and having bottles thrown at them while outside of an apartment on Eaton Street. "I made direct eye contact with the student on the balcony and I saw him deliberately throw a bottle at the back of Tati's head," said another student, Phionna Claude. "Thankfully, it missed her by a couple of steps, but he was deliberately targeting her with a bottle." "A big gray storage bin of water was dumped over the balcony," said Ivy Barclay, a third student. A providence police officer was at the scene. He wrote in a report that he did not see anything thrown at the women.

title: Re: ATM machines
text:
The original poster doesn't know what he/she is talking about. Just another CL nut job spreading their conspiracy fantasies around. After years of working with ATM machines of all types, I know something about how the business works. First, 99% of the time the ATMs placed in stores that the O.P. mentioned are owned by private small ATM companies that have no affliation with the store the machine is located in. They lease the space and pay rent for the using that location, the ATM company makes their money from charging you an assininely high surcharge fee for withdrawing money from their ATM, the store makes money because they get to charge hundreds of dollars a month in rent for about two square feet of floor space.

The idea that stores intentionally have ATM's at their location linked to their cash register system is completely retarded. For one thing the ATM's typically placed in those locations are the cheapest, oldest dinosaur second hand ATM machines. When you can hear an old school dial up phone modem kicking on during a transaction, that should give you a clue as to how fast and modern those machines really are. So the machines don't even have the technical capability to share private information with the store they are located in. 

The other big question is what would be the point? The store already has all the information anyone would need to rip you off as soon as you swipe a card and enter in a PIN number at the cash register. What would they gain by getting the same information from an ATM machine. If anything the truth is even more scary if you are all paranoid about people stealing your financial info, because the O.P.'s claim just involves the store, in reality if you make a purchase at the register and then withdraw money from the ATM, now TWO different companies will have all your card information. 

Welcome to 2016 folks, if you actually think there is such a thing as real privacy and anonymity in the digital age, I have a nice bridge in New York I'll sell ya.

title: WARNING ABOUT ATM Machines around Providence Area
text:
This is a WARNING about using non-bank owned ATM's throughout the state, PARTICULARLY in the Providence area. I'm not supposed to be sharing this information, but feel the public should be warned despite the thoughts and decisions made by my superiors and others (law, investigators, etc.)
DO NOT USE NON-BANK ATM'S TO WITHDRAW CASH...ESPECIALLY at the same store your card was used in a point-of-sale type transaction. 
It seems the store's credit/debit readers and computers are connected, whether knowingly or unknowingly by the store (that is unknown at this time), to the ATM Machine. A VIRUS has been placed in multiple locations/stores throughout Providence and the surrounding area that grabs your PIN # and enables the "hacker" or whoever is responsible for this scheme to withdraw money from your bank accounts, transfer money electronically from your accounts to so-far-untraceable accounts, AND tap into lines of credit if they are available on said card.
BEWARE! Spread the word! Don't become another victim!

title: Herpes, shingles, chicken pox, etc
text:
All of these things are blisters caused by VARIOUS viruses, The confusion seems to stem from the causes, the contacts, the method of transfer, the outbreak areas and so on.

But...ALL viruses, all transmitted, all of them gross, painful - AND treated with Valtrex (or similar) - regardless of which virus. 

I had chicken pox as a kid, which came back as shingles (now that I'm old) - same virus, running around inside me inactive for 50 years, yuck.
I've never had the virus that is connected with sexually transmitted herpes (simplex 1&2, eg). 
Cold sores ARE caused by a herpes virus. "Genital" or "oral" herpes is where it occurs, not the name of the virus.

Yes, there is a lot of confusion. I suggest you get your information from Webmd, Mayo Clinic and so on, Though CL might have a number of sufferers, there doesn't seem to be much in the line of disease control.

title: buddy
text: I was real sorry to hear of the passing of buddy Cianci. I was a pretty steady listener to his show. I am glad I caught his last radio show yesterday. I thought it was kinda funny to hear buddy telling his audience who all the crooks were in Providence. Buddy, like all of us, had his faults. I am not from RI, but there is no doubt how much he loved Rhode Island and the city of Providence. Buddy's imprints all all over the city of RI, and he was a large reason for the resurgence of the city. I greatly enjoyed his radio show. One of the things I greatly admired about Buddy was his love of people and the respect he would grant the folks that call in. Some of the other "personalities" on WPRO are just downright abusive and rude to the callers. The worst thing I ever heard buddy say was "throw up a flare when you are about to make a point." Buddy was one of a kind. Providence was lucky to have had him.

title: I assume the younger people don't know
text: The legacy of Buddy Cianci, we all realize that he was a convicted felon but went on to be re-elected severed another 11 years as mayor (it's got to be one of the first times in political history that someone has done so). So take it as you may but he Loved Providence and wanted it to be a major player (which he did). Providence would not be what it is today had he not been re-elected.

title: Buddy Cianci (RIP).
text:
I know the history of Buddy Cianci, but when he promised that he would get a project accomplished for X amount of dollars, it was always done within or below budget (grant it that he received a nice cut) but that is the way RI did business in the day. Look at the Big Dig for instance, the lowest quote that they went with turned out to be a disaster, they had to hire a new contractor to fix what the previous contractor screwed up which I believe was 3-4 times the 1st quote (which was in the Billions) actual quote and they are still having problems with leakage in the tunnels and god only knows what else has to be done.
This was one if not the highest construction projects ever in US history.
Had Buddy been in charge of that project there is NO Way you would have seen anything like that happen. 
Say what you may (I know he F@#ked up Big Time) but as Buddies replacement Mayor Joe Paolino said on the 5pm channel 10 broadcast, there are two sides to Buddy, some only look at the bad but you have to consider what good he had done for Providence, Providence would not be what it is today had he not been in control of operations.
With that said, I know there will be a lot of negative responses / posts, you also have to consider how he dramatically changed the face of Providence and helped to make it what it is today.
Others have tried to take credit for the changes but they are only picking up where he left off.

title: Mayor Cianci, you will be missed
text:
What a shock hearing the former mayor had passed.
I'm from Massachusetts but have been coming to Providence since the early 80's and watched the city change for the good under Mr. Cianci's watch. I met him once at waterfire.We chatted for a short period but you could tell he was a genuinely nice guy.All I can say is what a loss for the good city of Providence. RIP
Mayor Cianci.
